intro: Gaertnera inflexa, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are usually pale yellow or white. Gaertnera inflexa is known for its hardy nature and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
